Description: Heart-shaped good luck card, given at weddings, made of folded biscuit wrappers sewn onto a plastic base ,trimmed with lace, and with a central image (postcard) showing a bride and groom in European dress.
Acquisition notes: Af1991,23.1 to 22 is described in the purchase book as "a small ethnographical collection [formed by Christopher Spring of the Ethnography Department of the BM] during a brief period of fieldwork in the oases of the western desert of Egypt in November 1991." The purchase cost was refunded to him.
